page.title: 14 LOCAL RADIO
page.content: Hereward Radio news goes out every hour on the airwaves of Northampton from 6.00a.m. to 3.00a.m. on a frequency of 1557KH. The radio station has a team of six journalists. Local news and information is first of all gathered by people reporting in to the station and then the station responding by sending one of its team members to cover the story. For national and international news items a derivative of the London Broadcasting Company(LBC) known as Independent Radio News(IRN)will cover such items and contact the local radio stations by Telex and/or Audio channels of communication. When reporting a story the journalists use special tape recorders for the interviews which are recorded onto ordinary tape cassettes. These are later transferred to reel tapes and edited in the studio before being broadcast.
